from vpython import *

scene = canvas(title="Simple Pendulum", width=800, height=600, center=vec(0,0,0), background=vec(0.5,0.5,0))

g = 9.8 # acceleration due to gravity

# Creating the pendulum bob and the rod
bob = sphere(pos=vec(Length_I,0,0), radius=0.5, color=color.blue)
rod = cylinder(pos=vec(0,0,0), axis=bob.pos, radius=0.1)

# Initial conditions
bob.theta = pi/4 # initial angle
bob.omega = 0 # initial angular velocity
bob.alpha = 0 # initial angular acceleration

# Time variables
t = 0 # start time
dt = 0.01 # time step

while True:
    rate(100)
    bob.alpha = -(g/Length_I)*sin(bob.theta) # Calculate angular acceleration
    bob.omega += bob.alpha*dt # Update angular velocity
    bob.theta += bob.omega*dt # Update angle

    bob.pos = vec(Length_I*sin(bob.theta), -Length_I*cos(bob.theta), 0) # Update position
    rod.axis = bob.pos # Update rod's axis

    t += dt # Increment time
